column1:
Tuzi,"2022-11-10T17:36:03.407Z","An odd assortment of mismatched parts","

I got this set for free when I ordered 50+ euros worth of PAB parts.

My first impression of this set was mostly confusion. The parts included are somewhat rare amongst LEGO sets, but what the hell can I use them for? There doesn't seem to be much of a consistency between the parts, they're all in wild colours and only a few of them seem to be somewhat useful in my builds.
The following parts stood out to me:

column3: • While they're nice to have, the only visors included in the bag are bright orange divers masks. That don't cover the entire helmet.
• These would've been useful if only the bag also included pink blank heads.

column2: • 2 blank glow in the dark heads

column3: • Neat? I might find a usage for these somewhere but I don't really see much point in them.
• Probably one of the most exciting parts, only appearing once every few years. I'll be using mine for a butcher shop >:)
• At least I think they're pineapples? The bag doesn't have a part for the green leaves, and the print isn't wrapped around the entire head. No idea what to use these for.
• I happen to be a huge fan of LEGO's CNY sets, so I was happy to see these, though I wish they added more. Will go great in the Chinatown part of my city.
• I haven't really seen other parts in this odd colour yet. Neat, I guess? It feels like the colour is too niche for any practical usage.

column1: Overall it feels like the bag is part creator, part "hey look at these odd parts we happen to produce". There's really no real theme unlike the previous couple VIP bags. Nice to have, I suppose, but I would never buy this bag on its own.
